bibl.title: Letter from A.M. Stimson to Henry Rose Carter, January 30, 1915

div1.p: Stimson discusses his recent investigations of syphilitics.

div1.head: Letter from A.M. Stimson to Henry Rose Carter, January 30, 1915
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF
THE DIRECTOR, HYGIENIC LABORATORY
25TH AND E STREETS N. W.
IN REPLYING ADDRESS THE
DIRECTOR, HYGIENIC LABORATORY
25TH AND E STREETS N. W.
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
January 30, 1915.
SF
Senior Surgeon H. R. Carter,
Public Health Service,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
In connection with the Wassermann
examinations I have recently commenced running a par-
allel set of tubes with tubercle bacilli antigen as
a matter of routine. This has been done as a mat-
ter of research and the results are to be regarded,
for the present, as of academic interest.

In the case of two sera recently sent for Wasser-
mann examination from your hospital I find strong evi-
dence of fixation with the Tb.antigen, namely, in pa-
tients J. Nelson, who also gives strong fixation with
syphilitic antigen, and John Byrnes, who gives no fix-
ation with the syphilitic antigen. May I request
that these patients be examined, if practicable, with
a view to determining the possibility of their having
an active tuberculous lesion and the results of the
examination communicated to me?

Certain authors have noted that syphilitic sera
frequently show fixation with Tb. antigens which have
been ascribed to the lipoid content of the latter.
H.R.C. - 2
However, Bronfen-Brenner claims to have demonstrated
that such sera contain two distinct antibodies, one
syphilitic and the other tuberculous, and that the
significance of the phenomenon is in reality that many
syphilitics are, by reason of their disease, rendered
more susceptible to tuberculosis and suffer from it
in an active but often undetected form.

I hope by these tests, in cooperation with care-
ful clinical examinations, to be able to throw some
light upon this subject and shall appreciate your co-
operation.

closer.signed:
A. M. Stimson
Assistant Director
Hygienic Laboratory
